node.title: Coupling with gradients of Material property
node.bodyText:
Hi, moose-developers, here is Q about the extension of #22910  and #24361
as these previous anwsers, I would like to calculate the gradient of material property(scalar) locally which means the additional dofs canbe avoid.
Q1
in #24361, a new Material object (MaterialPropertyGradient) maybe implemented but I could not find it. How can I use this function to get this MaterialPropertyGradient like getMaterialPropertyGradient<RealVectorValue>() ??
Q2 if the Q1 not
I tried the suggestion by gary in his app https://github.com/hugary1995/eel/blob/main/src/materials/chemistry/ChemicalPotential.C#L56-L78, I just changed the derivatives of energys term to local scalar material property. Unfortunately, when I got the gradients of it within computeQpResidual or computeQpJacobian in kernels (not AD), the nodal result is not continuous. Could you give me
some helps about the gradient of material property in non-AD kernels ?
Thanks
tianwen
@hugary1995

Hi giud, I  wanna make sure I am not misunderstanding, it will help me to solve this problem maybe.
Q1
If I wanna do some operations locally in one element, is it correct focus on computeProperties ?
after the Qps loop on computeQpProperty().
so that, I can get material properties (scalar) on all of Qps in this element using oneMaterialProperty[_qp].
Q2: Id of Qps in one element
is it correct using just _qp ?
Q3: current coordinates of one Qp in one element
is it correct using just '_q_point[_qp] (x/y/z)' ?
Thanks.
tianwen

Q1 for most applications you are meant to implement computeQpProperties not computeProperties
If you want to override the computeProperties, yes you will have access to the property at every Qp after a loop calling computeQpProperties

Q2
Yes the index in an element of the properties is _qp
Q3 that s correct though x should index 0, y index 1 etc

guid, Thanks for these, I understood. That's make sense to me.
tianwen

    phase_base = 'eta0 eta1 eta2'
    h = 'h0     h1   h2'

[]

node.title: Trouble creating geometry and diffusion (STEP 1) when following Workshop 2023 Video

node.title: How do I specify torch::nn::Upsample scale_factor?
node.bodyText:
Check these boxes if you have followed the posting rules.

 Q&A General is the most appropriate section for my question
 I have consulted the posting Guidelines on the Discussions front page
 I have searched the Discussions forum and my question has not been asked before
 I have searched the MOOSE website and the documentation does not answer my question
 I have formatted my post following the posting guidelines (screenshots as a last resort, triple back quotes around pasted text)

Question
I am tryting to specify an Upsample module in a torch::nn::Sequential argument list. The documentation in
moose/framework/contrib/libtorch/include/torch/csrc/api/include/torch/nn/options/upsampling.h
gives the example
/// model(UpsampleOptions().scale_factor({3}).mode(torch::kLinear).align_corners(false));
but I don't know how to apply that information.
I have tried this line
 torch::nn::Upsample(),
and it compiles but gets the runtime error "either size or scale_factor should be defined".
I want to specify a scale_factor of 2. These are some of the ways that I have tried to implement this:
      torch::nn::Upsample(nullptr, 2.0),
      torch::nn::Upsample(void, 2.0),
      torch::nn::Upsample(2.0),
      torch::nn::Upsample(scale_factor{2.0}),
      torch::nn::Upsample(scale_factor={2}),
      torch::nn::Upsample(scale_factor({2})),
      torch::nn::Upsample(torch::nn::UpsampleOptions().scale_factor({2})),
      torch::nn::Upsample(torch::nn::UpsampleOptions(scale_factor({2}))),


but none of them compile.

Hello
seems more of a torch question than a moose one.
@grmnptr or @somu15  might know still
Guillaume

I found the answer in pytorch cppdocs
torch::nn::Upsample(torch::nn::UpsampleOptions().scale_factor(std::vector<double>({2}))),

this I dont know about.
I m guessing you need to make a commit to fix this
subprocess.CalledProcessError: Command '['git', 'rev-parse', 'HEAD']' returned non-zero exit status 128.

as for this
/home/ubuntu/projects/hmch/src/kernels/hfConvection.C: In member function 'virtual libMesh::Real hfConvection::computeQpResidual()':
/home/ubuntu/projects/hmch/src/kernels/hfConvection.C:37:61: error: expression cannot be used as a function
   37 |   return _miu[_qp]* _grad_u[_qp] * _test[_i][_qp](_component);

It should be _test[_i][_qp], no indexing by component. If you want vector test functions you need to use the VectorKernel base class not the Kernel like you have currently.

what about this:
/home/ubuntu/projects/hmch/src/kernels/hfDiffusions.C: In member function 'virtual libMesh::Real hfDiffusions::computeQpResidual()':
/home/ubuntu/projects/hmch/src/kernels/hfDiffusions.C:37:70: error: cannot convert 'libMesh::TypeVector' to 'libMesh::Real' {aka 'double'} in return
37 |   return _lamda[_qp]* _grad_u[_qp] * _grad_test[_i]_qp + _miu[_qp] * _grad_u[_qp] * _grad_test[_i]_qp;

This is because the expression you wrote is a vector and you are supposed to return a float
So you are missing either access into a compoent of a vector or a scalar product

node.title: Steady-State Relative Differential Norm nan but solve converges well
node.bodyText:
Check these boxes if you have followed the posting rules.

 Q&A General is the most appropriate section for my question
 I have consulted the posting Guidelines on the Discussions front page
 I have searched the Discussions forum and my question has not been asked before
 I have searched the MOOSE website and the documentation does not answer my question
 I have formatted my post following the posting guidelines (screenshots as a last resort, triple back quotes around pasted text)

Question
Hello MOOSE community,
I have a question on detecting steady state.
I got a report "Steady-State Relative Differential Norm: -nan" from my solve. However, my solve converges well.
After several time steps, my nonlinear residual already drops below my set tolerance, which means the my system does not evolve anymore. However, Steady-State Relative Differential Norm: -nan.
My question is how come such on one hand, it converges, on the other hand, Steady-State Relative Differential Norm: -nan?
Thank you,
Jiangang

I have figured it out.
I  haved turned on check_aux = true however there is no auxvariable or auxkernel in my input file.
Thank you.

node.title: Not a registered object
node.bodyText:
I get the error below when I run my input script. This was not the case before I installed my MOOSE again on my HPC cluster.
A 'RankTwoScalarAux' is not a registered object.check_inp(moose_srv)
If you are trying to find this object in a dynamically loaded library, make sure thatcheck_inp(moose_srv)
the library can be found either in your "Problem/library_path" parameter or in thecheck_inp(moose_srv)
MOOSE_LIBRARY_PATH environment variable.

it means that 'RankTwoScalarAux' does not exist in your moose directory.
probably you need to check the directory: moose/modules/tensor_mechanics/src/auxkernels
if it is not there, you can get it from moose page and put it in right directory, then compile it.

This auxkernel has been around since 2017 so I dont think that's the problem.
I think the executable is not compiled with the solid mechanics module maybe? Can you check the Makefile for your app and make sure the SOLID_MECHANICS field is set to yes?
Once that's done, you ll need to clean and recompile

if it is not there, you can get it from moose page and put it in right directory, then compile it.

we dont recommend doing that.
Instead update MOOSE.
when you clean, use git clean -xfd and use it in the top folder of the app
I set all my modules to yes when I compiled my application. Nevertheless, I am going to do it again.
The cleaning before compiling part is important too unfortunately

Yes, I cleaned my app folder before compiling it. For the record, I used this in compiling:
cd ~/projects/YourAppName
make clobberall
make -j 6
./run_tests -j 6

I run into this problem after doing that:
WASP does not seem to be available.
Make sure to either run scripts/update_and_rebuild_wasp.sh in your MOOSE directory,
or set WASP_DIR to a valid WASP install

note that make clobberall is not cleaning enough. You need to bring out the big deep clean guns with git clean -Xfd

Question
Hi all,
I would like to use FileMeshComponent of [THM], [TensorMechanics], and [heat conduction] together in the same input file to do the fully coupled simulation.
If the [TensorMechanics] is not included in this file, there is no problem. If I add the [TensorMechanics] part in the input file, the error shows:

Here is the simple input file:
file_mesh_component.txt
I checked the position of this error in QuasiStaticSolidMechanicsPhysics:

I think each block and subdomain is defined. Why did this error occur?

Hello
This is not possible currently. Unless you create a SolidMechanicsComponent that does a lot of what the TensorMechanics action does. This is what was was done for the FlowComponentNS
I am reworking components in this PR
#27593
Once I m done there you ll be able to instantiate any of 'Physics' on this kind of component.
Guillaume
